column1: Photophobia is eye discomfort in bright light.

Causes may include: - Acute iritis or uveitis (inflammation inside the eye) - Burns to the eye - Corneal abrasion - Corneal ulcer - Drugs such as amphetamines, atropine, cocaine, cyclopentolate, idoxuridine, phenylephrine, scopolamine, trifluridine, tropicamide, and vidarabine - Excessive wearing of contact lenses, or wearing badly-fitted contact lenses - Eye disease, injury, or infection (such as chalazion, episcleritis, glaucoma) - Eye testing when the eyes have been dilated - Meningitis - Migraine headache - Recovery from eye surgery
